result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey J Dahmen was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and Maintain full time employment during period of probation.

Probation may be transferred to Dane County if they accept it.
Do not possess or consume alcohol during period of probation.
Absolute sobriety with respect to alcohol.
Not be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with any counseling and assessments that may be recommended by the agent.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Jeffrey J Dahmen in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-139, 15TR-916, 15TR-917 and 15TR-1036.

8:34 AM Court calls cases.
Matters are set for a plea hearing this morning.
Court states appearances.

There is an agreement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1 in 15CF-139. Count 2 will be dismissed. Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.
TR cases will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Cousins states the plea agreement for the record.
Atty Renc concurs, requests that probation and jail be transferred to Dane County.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 in 15CF-139

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-139: Count 1: OWI 4th
15CF-139: Count 2: Dismissed
15CF-139: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-916: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-917: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-1036: Dismissed and Read In

15CF-139
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Probation may be transferred to Dane County if they accept it

Jail sentence for 6 Months
Jail credit for 23 days
60 days to start the jail
Report to jail today to set start date
Jail may be transferred to Dane County if they accept it
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations

Absolute sobriety with respect to alcohol

Defendant Jeffrey J Dahmen in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jeffrey J Dahmen in custody. ADA Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BTC: Amended bond down to $500 cash bond:  Treatment at the Journey Mental Center and to reside with his parents and also Day Report on days of Court.
Pre-trial conference at 06-01-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Jeffrey J Dahmen in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:46 pm. Atty Cousins calls case.


Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Matter to be heard in Br 2 for Bond modification.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
and Notice of Motion
Preliminary hearing at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Jeffrey J Dahmen appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant was appointed Anne Renc.  She is out sick today.  Someone was supposed to cover for her today. Requests to address bond at this time.
Atty Cousins requests to set for a prelim and he will advise her of the date.
Defendant requests a signature bond to allow him to move into the address he was supposed to move into in Wisconsin Rapids. 

BY THE COURT: Request is denied.  Bond Continued.   Defendant to file a request with Br 1.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$2,000 cash bond: Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
